content.description: Climbs a steep off width chimney for 60 feet.
content.protection: Pro to 8+ inches to a 2 bolt anchor WITHOUT chains.
content.location: Right of Stick Like a Tick

content.description: Begin the route a for the route Reach, but break right at the second bolt, moving right of the bulging arete, to follow knobs and tiny pockets over a steep slab.  The crux comes between the 3rd and 4th bolts.
content.protection: 6 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor with chains.

content.description: The main traditional line on this otherwise sporty cliff.  A right leaning offwidth to a chimney.
content.location: The obvious trad line for this formations namesake.

content.description: Start the route at the base of the overhanging rock with large holds past 2 bolts to a bulge.  Clip the 3rd bolt and pull the bulge.  Stand on the bulge and clip the 4th bolt and get a good shake to prepare battle with upcoming crux.  Staying left of the arete "REACH" and high step, pulling past crimps and pockets to the anchors.
content.protection: 7 bolts with a  2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: Follows the right side bulging arete on the formation right of King of Goddamns.

climbs.name: Queen of Sweet Nothings
climbs.fa: F.A. TR, Aaron Smith and Jake Whittaker. F.F.A. Chad Suchoski.

content.description:
From the ground, climb a splitter off hands crack that narrows down to barely accept fingertips. Now climb the beautiful face to the right of King of Goddamns heading up and to the right across steep face with long reaches between beautiful pockets.  Climb up into a lower angle ramp above to a mid way anchor.  The second half of this route moves up and right into the alcove above and finishes either by climbing up to a hard (5.12) hand/finger crack, which exits out the steep overhanging face above to finally finish on glory buckets to the anchor, or continues up the easy (5.6) alcove above.

5.11c to the first anchors. 5.12 if finishing on the crack above.
content.protection: 6 bolts to a two bolt anchor. Gear, cams .2" to 1".
content.location: Start just up and right from King of Goddamns.

content.description: Route takes the same line as King of Goddamns, but move right of the aerie through thin and very steep terrain.
content.protection: 9 bolts with a 2 bolt anchor and chains- bolted by Travis Klawin

content.description: Follow thin and overhanging terrain up and over the route Roadside Distraction, passing thin smooth features.
content.protection: 8 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor with chains.  Bolted by Travis Klawin
content.location: Furthest left bolted line on the formation.

content.description: Starts right of Roadside Distraction.  Begin up steep and unprotected terrain for 20 feet before clipping the first bolt, then break left climbing thin moves passing 4 bolts.  The route then crosses Roadside Distraction and 3 more bolts.
content.protection: 8 bolts with 2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: Approximately 20 feet right of Roadside Distraction.

content.description: Same start as for the route Murder, but after clipping the first bolt, move right along a right facing dihedral, following pockets and some crimps past 3 more bolts through 5.11a terrain.  Once at the upper headwall bulge the difficulty begins moving left of the arete, clipping 3 more bolts before the anchors.
content.protection: 8 bolts with a  2 bolt anchor with chains.
